chunks.original_text: 夜深人静，披衣闲坐，琴听无弦。 罢高谈、逸论默通玄。 任龟息绵绵。 阴阳升降，冲和四大，骨壮神全。 抱元初、一点行功圆。 看歌舞胎仙。 太平兴国观中秋赏月 海清山静，素秋光满，凉夜人圆。 恣开怀、赏玩过三更。 更谈论幽玄。 圆明顿悟，无私普照，善行周全。 向今宵、觉彻性皆通，证陆地神仙。 一剪梅十首 依先师真人和移刺仲泽韵，义州永和庵作。 九九方终暖日阳。 春和崇义，无梦天长。 十方三界恣游行，炎夏还逢，不觉秋霜。 悟得真闲万事忘。 自然佚乐，心地清凉。 本来一点纵宽舒，散尽群魔，独现威光。 示众复用前韵 外积阴功内固阳。 长春示众，此语偏长。 还能顿悟入无为，宿业犹如，赫日消霜。 不假澄心六欲忘。 功成行满，越过炎凉。 腾腾兀兀任西东，觉彻人间，且恁韬光。 太平兴国观示众 天赐平遥好歇心。 琳宫寂寂，古柏森森。 清阴密锁洞天幽，聚落相邻，静胜山林。 清静无为孰得寻。 太平兴国，觅个知音。 劝君速悟莫迟疑，言下承当，贤圣加临。 寄蔚州道友 越过灵仙壶水傍。 西河饯送，诚厚难忘。 未能款话便登程，度岭严寒，来意匆忙。 幸得和平达道乡。 浑源丰足，诸事安康。 有人东去寄新词，报与知音，表我行藏。 咏前高山 新得前高一簇山。 清虚洞府，亘古仙坛。 皇天怜我苦奔驰，佚我年高，教我开颜。 暗谢高穹赐我闲。 松间石上，断了追攀。 忻然自得乐无穷，行也堪观，坐也堪观。 又 新得前高自发扬。
chunks.translated_text:
Deep in the quiet night, I don robes and sit at ease,
Listening to the stringless zither.
Ceasing lofty discourse, subtle words silently penetrate the mystery—
Freely abiding in the turtle’s unbroken breath.
Yin and yang rise and fall,
The four greats harmonize in balance,
Bones strong, spirit whole.
Embracing the primal origin, a single point completes the practice—
Behold the dancing immortal embryo.

*Mid-Autumn Moon Viewing at Taiping Xingguo Abbey*
The sea is calm, the mountains still,
Autumn’s pure light fills all,
A cool night gathers kindred souls.
We open our hearts,
Delighting past the third watch,
Further discoursing on the profound.
Perfect clarity dawns in sudden awakening,
Selfless and universally illuminating,
Virtuous deeds fully encompassed.
This very night, perceiving thoroughly, all natures interpenetrate—
Attaining the immortality of the solid earth.

*Ten Lyrics to "Yi Jian Mei"*
Following the rhyme of Master Yilaci Zhongze, composed at Yonghe Hermitage in Yizhou.

Only when the ninth nine-day period ends does the sun warm.
Spring harmonizes with lofty virtue,
Dreamless, the heavens stretch long.
Roaming freely through the ten directions and three realms,
Summer’s heat still met,
Unheeding autumn’s frost.

Awakened to true leisure, all affairs forgotten,
Naturally at ease and joyful,
The mind-ground cool and clear.
The original single point expands boundlessly,
Dispersing all demons,
Alone manifesting majestic radiance.

*Addressing the Assembly, Reusing the Previous Rhyme*
Externally accumulating hidden merit, internally fortifying yang.
The everlasting spring addresses the assembly—
These words are especially long.
If one can suddenly awaken to non-doing,
Past karma dissolves like frost beneath the blazing sun.

No need to still the mind or forget the six desires.
When merit is complete and conduct fulfilled,
Transcending heat and cold.
Carefree and unconstrained, drifting east or west,
Thoroughly awakened to the human realm—
Thus concealing one’s brilliance.

*Addressing the Assembly at Taiping Xingguo Abbey*
Heaven bestows Pingyao as a fine place to rest the heart.
Jade halls lie hushed,
Ancient cypresses stand dense.
Cool shade tightly seals the grotto-heaven’s seclusion,
Villages nearby,
Yet quieter than mountain forests.

Who can seek the Way of purity and non-doing?
At Taiping Xingguo Abbey,
Find a true kindred spirit.
I urge you to swiftly awaken—do not delay.
Accept it in this very moment,
And the worthy and sagely will descend upon you.

*Sent to Daoist Friends in Weizhou*
Beyond the waters beside the immortal’s pot,
By the Western River we bade farewell,
Sincerity and depth unforgettable.
Unable to speak at leisure before setting out,
Crossing the ridge through bitter cold,
My coming intent hasty.

Fortunately, peace reaches the land of the Dao,
Hunyuan abounds in sufficiency,
All affairs at peace.
If someone travels east, send them new verses,
To report to kindred spirits
And reveal my conduct and whereabouts.

*Ode to the Front High Mountain*
Newly acquired, the front high mountain stands in a cluster.
A realm of pure emptiness,
An ancient immortal altar.
Heaven pities my arduous toil,
Granting me advanced years,
Teaching me to open my countenance.

Silently I thank the lofty vault for bestowing leisure.
Amid pines and upon rocks,
All pursuit is severed.
Joyfully content, delight knows no bounds—
Worthy to behold whether walking or sitting.

*Again*
Newly acquired, the front high mountain proclaims itself.
A realm of pure emptiness,
An ancient immortal altar.

chunks.original_text: 峰峦峭拔，松桧成行。 道人归计出红尘，碧洞高眠，无事牵肠。 白发垂垂两鬓霜。 青松影裹，描邈难妆。 往来游戏日当斜，行也清凉，坐也清凉。 又 新得前高孰可知。 世间清绝，诗笔难题。 朝元峰上试闲窥，未赴蓬莱，先到瑶池。 一派松风入耳吹。 仙音缥缈，洞达幽微。 兴来策杖步云溪，行也相宜，坐也相宜。 述怀赠程老先生 学道无成天不悭。 虚名滥占，实得应难。 从今志气更重加，东望都休，不下西山。 深谢知交忻惇间。 四时不阙，助我衣餐。 有时庆会上朝元，功行双全，日赴千坛。 述怀赠柳先生 一点灵明本寂然。 随通随感，应赴诸缘。 头头认得这些儿，动也方圆，静也方圆。 日用无私不着边。 清虚消息，此法堪传。 指人顿悟入无为，行也忘言，坐也忘言。 下山 为爱前高自觉过。
chunks.translated_text:
Peaks rise sheer and towering,
Pines and cypresses stand in rows.
The Daoist’s plan to retreat from the red dust—
In the azure grotto, high and serene,
No affairs to bind the heart.

White hair hangs heavy, frost at both temples.
Within the shadow of green pines,
All adornment fades to remoteness.
Coming and going in playful ease as the sun slants low—
Walking brings coolness,
Sitting brings coolness.

*Again*
Who can know the newly gained Front High?
Its purity surpasses the world,
Yet the poet’s brush cannot capture it.
From the Peak of Morning Ascent, I gaze in idle leisure—
Before reaching Penglai,
I first arrive at Jasper Pool.

A gust of pine wind blows into my ears,
Celestial strains drift faintly,
Penetrating the subtle and profound.
When the mood strikes, I lean on my staff and wander the clouded stream—
Walking is fitting,
Sitting is fitting.

*Expressing My Feelings to Master Cheng*
My Dao studies bear no fruit, yet Heaven is not stingy.
I occupy an undeserved reputation,
Hard-pressed to claim true attainment.
From now on, my resolve redoubles—
Gazing east, I let all rest,
Never descending from the western mountain.

Deep gratitude to my steadfast friends,
Whose support in all four seasons never fails,
Providing me with clothing and food.
At times of celebration, ascending to Morning Ascent Peak,
Both merit and conduct perfected,
Daily attending a thousand altars.

*Expressing My Feelings to Master Liu*
A single spark of numinous clarity, originally still,
Flowing with whatever arises, responding to all conditions.
Recognizing all these as they are—
In motion, it is round;
In stillness, it is round.

In daily use, it is selfless and untouched by edges,
The subtle workings of pure emptiness—
This Dharma is worthy of transmission.
Guiding others to sudden awakening into non-action—
Walking, words forgotten;
Sitting, words forgotten.

*Descending the Mountain*
For love of Front High, I realize my excess.

chunks.original_text: 天生阻隔，不放冲和。 前头何处道缘探，无福清闲，有分奔波。 老也功亏一任魔。 长春教语，慎勿蹉跎。 自来达道学仙人，功也无多，行也无多。 下手迟 义州醮罢劝众 诸缘种种怎生休，万虑纷纷何日息。 情忘处、诸缘顿了，意灭时、万虑俱毕。 问君能有几多时，犹向人间弄智识。 还知恁么便回光，兔使临头愁戚戚。 昭君怨 泉州洞直观书于东壁 节令重阳闲步，真至武清南渡。 极目看嘉祥，水茫茫。 连日阴沉微雨，正在芦花深处。 游乐水云间，望西山。 凤栖梧 观世
chunks.translated_text:
Heaven-born barriers block the flow of harmonious qi.
Where lies the path ahead to seek the Dao’s affinity?
Without the fortune for leisure,
With the fate for toil—
Even in old age, merit remains incomplete, left to the whims of demons.

The Long Spring Teachings warn:
Beware of wasted time.
Those who from the start attain the Dao and study immortality—
Their merit is not great,
Their conduct is not great.

Too late to begin—

*Exhorting the Assembly After the Yizhou Ritual*
How can the myriad conditions ever cease?
When will the thousand cares ever quiet?
When emotions fade, all conditions suddenly end;
When thoughts vanish, all cares wholly cease.

Ask yourself: how much time remains?
Yet still you toy with worldly cleverness.
If you knew to turn your light inward now,
You would not wait in sorrow as misfortune nears.

*Zhaojun’s Resentment*
*Inscribed on the Eastern Wall of Dongzhi Abbey, Quanzhou*

On the Double Ninth, a leisurely stroll,
I arrive at Wuqing’s southern crossing.
Gazing afar at the auspicious scene—
Waters stretch boundless.

For days, overcast skies and gentle rain,
Now deep among the reeds.
Reveling amid the shifting waters and clouds,
I look toward West Mountain.

*Phoenix Perches on the Wutong Tree*
*Observing the World*

chunks.original_text: 大教普闻天下转。 返朴全真，日用垂方便。 方便真慈清静愿，心通渐觉人情远。 上士高明容易劝。 既悟玄风，早早忘知见。 世事安能长久恋，不如认证元初面。 葆光集下竟
chunks.translated_text:
The Great Teaching spreads throughout the world,
Returning to simplicity, preserving the True—
In daily practice, offering expedient means.
Expedient true compassion, pure and still in vow,
The heart connects, gradually sensing worldly ties grow distant.

The superior person, wise and enlightened, is easily persuaded.
Having awakened to the mysterious wind,
Swiftly forget knowledge and perception.
How can worldly affairs be long cherished?
Better to recognize and verify the original face.

*Concluding the Lower Scroll of Preserving the Light*
